comments:
Very close to the train station, and David provided good directions to the apartment--10 minute walk. VERY lively area, with the Red Light district a block away, lots of foot traffic. That said, a canal is right across the street, and our apartment was in the back, so not too noisy. We walked or took a tram everywhere. Very nice cafes for breakfast right around the corner (omelets at one, German pancakes at the other).
Anne Frank house is a madhouse of tourists, as is the new Van Gogh museum (Sunflowers is there--wow--but remember, Starry Night is at MOMA), unfortunately. Rijksmuseum is fantastic, well worth the cost. Just walking around the city is great. Take the free ferry outside the train station and explore across the water and explore the new(ish) EYE Filmmuseum, as well as all the new construction.
Amsterdam is frenetic. The word "chaos" comes to mind, with all the motion, a zillion bicycles, a hundred languages, and--unlike other Euro cities--pedestrians to NOT have 'right-of-way' over cars or bikes. It can be a really fun, exciting city, but--especially if you're middle-aged or older (as we are)--keep your eyes open and have a good sense of humor.
And David's apartment is a really well-located base from which to do Amsterdam exploring.

There is one flight of stairs up to the room, and I do not think this is a negative for most travelers. The stairs are straight up (not curved with "triangle" stair treads), and there is a firmly set banister on both sides of the stairs if you feel safer going up and down holding on to something. At the top of the stairs is a library of Amsterdam places to go and things to do.

David has really thought of everything. Without being intrusive, he has still found a way to make things better for his guests all the time. I highly recommend this accommodation for single travelers or for couples. You will not be disappointed. Jane

I had a business trip arranged to Amsterdam for the IBC Conference, and after initially being sent to a low-grade hotel with very inflated prices I decided to find another option. As people that know me, I like my hotels and will send extra time researching and finding a good deal if I can stay somewhere nice! Tripadvisor is my friend!

After some googling I stumbled across AirBNB, and after further searching I found David‚Äôs House. I have always had an aversion to B&B, so I was a little skeptical but it looked better than the hotel!

I was about to be proven totally wrong about the whole B&B experience!

David has a lovely house, and if I could say one thing then it‚Äôs location, location, location. I cannot think of a more perfect place to be located, right in the center of the craziness that is Amsterdam, but in a room so quiet! The room was of a standard as good as any 5 star hotel I have stayed in. Even had an honor mini bar! The bathroom / wet room had a rain shower. I believe that David has 2 on-suite rooms in this house (maybe more), and he lives upstairs.

I had my own key, which opened the front door which led up a single flight of stairs. I never met anyone else while I was there. I was offered a breakfast basket, but I declined as I always met with colleagues for coffee. I could come and go without all the hassle you sometimes get in hotels! The room was also very bright, with large windows. It was a hot weekend in Amsterdam (27c) and I had no problems as there was large fan and you could open the external windows.

I go to Amsterdam about once or twice a year, and if available I will definitely be staying again! Thank you David for a great stay!

I am also planning a couple more trips and will use AirBNB again! I told far too many people of my AirBNB experience at IBC, who unlike me had been sent to very poor hotels!

As first-time Air BnB'ers, we were so impressed by how clean our room was and how the place was professionally run. I would be so bold to say that it was better than you could ever ask for in a hotel room, and at a more reasonable cost. This whole experience truly exceeded our expectations.

Breakfast was served daily before 9am and arrived in this cute little basket just outside our door. It contained everything you needed to start your day and was absolutely perfect.

A few other comments:

- Location, Location, Location > in the heart of it all. 5 min walk from the train station, walking distance or easy transit to all main attractions
- Quiet > although you'll be located in "party central", when you want to sleep it will be as quiet as can be (we were on the first floor which did not face the canal)
- Bed was super comfy
- Shower was hot and had excellent water pressure (not that I would mind either way, but some people reading this might)
- Towels and other supplies were stocked daily, or as needed
- Free wifi
- Laundry facilities down the street, around the corner (for those who decided to pack light like us)


We hope that with our next Airbnb experience, we will find as excellent of a place as this :)

Keep up the great work David and friends!

Jen & Mark
Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Excellent from every point of view.
Location: 5 min walk from the train station, on the edge of the red district, in a safe, good looking, conveniently located spot, overlooking a water channel crossing.
Room: clean, bright, large and furnished with great taste. Kettle, nice lcd tv, minibar, wifi... nothing is missing
Hosts: great guys, easy going and pleasant. Very discreet but available for every need or info.
Definitely recommended!
Although I like to change, it will be my first choice in case of any further visit to Amsterdam
Our first bnb experience. It was perfect. Clean, modern room with a large bed. Very central to all stations. David was a perfect host. 5`Star bnb! Thank you David !

David was a great host. His apartment is very nice: comfortable bed, fast internet, and a nice bathroom. It is also in a great location. Footsteps from the Central Station for trains/trams/metro and very close to everything by foot. Breakfast in the morning was delicious and made for a great start to the day. 5 star b&b

My first AirBnb experience. Really neat ! The room was just as described : large, beautiful, clean, modern. It felt like it was brand new. There was absolutely no noise, even on week end days, and yet the room is in the best location we could hope for. David's friend warmly welcomed us, and was available on the phone if needed.
We highly recommend this place.
To stay at David's home was a perfect time. The house is located near the central railway station alongside a beautiful canal and very quiet. Thanks for all David !
